instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2850 no backlight
threads.message:
Hi. Board has an Image but no Backlight. This board started as an lcd connector replacement to regain backlight because when old connector was tapped the backlight would go in and out. Tried known good working LCD. So I changed the connector and it seemed to work fine for a bit. Then backlight started going in and out. Now there is none at all.


F9800 is 12 V
PWM is 2.8 V
BKLT EN is .002 V (missing)
PPVIN is 4.93 V
R9731 .002 on pin 1

When I take measurements on pins 4 and 6 on Q9807, backlight starts to come through dim. Is this a grounding issue on Q9807? I have already replaced it. 

Thanks in advance. Have a good one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2850 no backlight
threads.message: Voltage on pin 2 and 5 of Q9807? LCD plugged in of course.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2850 no backlight
threads.message: I have 3.2 V on both 2 and 5 of Q9807. I have found that it wasn't me taking measurements on Q9807 that was causing the backlight circuit to activate, but from the pressure of the probes. So what is happening is when ever I flex the board from any point from CPU area left to the backlight area (The whole left side of the board with fans closest to me on table and LCD connector facing up) the backlight circuit becomes active. I don't believe it is the LCD connector because this is the second one I have tried. So obviously there is a fucked up trace/chip somewhere. But how the hell am I supposed to find it? Thanks again. Have a good one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2850 no backlight
threads.message: what do you get on BKL_PWM when the board is working vs. when it isn't?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2850 no backlight
threads.message: Hi,Thanks. 2.8V both ways.Also, I lose BKLT_EN when its not working. (no pressure applied)

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2850 no backlight
threads.message: Tap U9600 and tell me if this is directly affects the issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2850 no backlight
threads.message: Tapping U9600 definitely effects it backlight. But doesn't seem to anymore then flexing the rest of that side of the CPU. Maybe that's the week point and anywhere I put pressure on that side of CPU directly effects  u9600? Thanks.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2850 no backlight
threads.message: Pretty sure it is U9600. Carefully remove all edge bonding and reflow first. If that fucks up have fun reballing it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2850 no backlight
threads.message: Reflow of U9600 worked. Thanks guys.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2850 no backlight
threads.message: Replace C9560 while you are at it to prevent a return for GPU issues.
